channel.title: Tech Jr
channel.description: Thinking of pursuing a career as a programmer? Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero explore what it's like to break into the Tech field as junior developers as well as how to stay up-to-date on new technology.
channel.itunes:subtitle: A Tech podcast by Juniors Devs, for Junior Devs!
channel.itunes:author: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
channel.itunes:summary: Thinking of pursuing a career as a programmer? Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero explore what it's like to break into the Tech field as junior developers as well as how to stay up-to-date on new technology.

item.title: Kurtis Kemple on AWS Amplify and becoming a Developer with a Felony Conviction
item.description: We dive into working with AWS and cloud architecture this week with Kurt Kemple, a developer advocate for AWS. Kurt teaches us about AWS Amplify and how to get started with AWS, and then shares his story about getting started in the Tech industry as an Ex-con.
item.dc:creator: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:author: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:subtitle: We dive into working with AWS and cloud architecture this week with Kurt Kemple, a developer advocate for AWS. Kurt teaches us about AWS Amplify and how to get started with AWS, and then shares his story about getting started in the Tech industry as an Ex-con.

item.title: Testing Node Microservices with Gil Tayar
item.description: Testing is tough. This week we have Senior Applitools Architect Gil Tayar on the show to explain the types of testing, why you should test, and how to test node without pulling your hair out.
item.dc:creator: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:author: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:subtitle: Testing is tough. This week we have Senior Applitools Architect Gil Tayar on the show to explain the types of testing, why you should test, and how to test node without pulling your hair out.

item.title: Recruiter Mike Torres shares Job-Search Strategies and Secrets
item.description: Ever wondered what recruiters do or how they operate? We did. Mike Torres wants to transition to a developer career and was willing to take us behind the curtain of the recruiting world!
item.dc:creator: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:author: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:subtitle: Ever wondered what recruiters do or how they operate? We did. Mike Torres wants to transition to a developer career and was willing to take us behind the curtain of the recruiting world!

item.title: Let's Explain Programming Jargon
item.description: One of the hardest parts of programming is learning the basics. What are variables, functions, and recursion? Lee and Eddie attempt to tackle the basics in a way anyone can understand.
item.dc:creator: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:author: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:subtitle: One of the hardest parts of programming is learning the basics. What are variables, functions, and recursion? Lee and Eddie attempt to tackle the basics in a way anyone can understand.

item.title: Chris Biscardi introduces Gatsby Themes
item.description: Chris Biscardi joins us this week to talk about Gatsby Themes, MDX, consulting, why companies should hire juniors, and Rocket League
item.dc:creator: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:author: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:subtitle: Chris Biscardi joins us this week to talk about Gatsby Themes, MDX, consulting, why companies should hire juniors, and Rocket League

item.title: Aisha Blake talks juniors, conferences, and diversity in the tech industry
item.description: Aisha Blake joins us this week to explain how she ended up speaking at 14 conferences this past year as a junior developer, as well as starting a few of her own.
item.dc:creator: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:author: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:subtitle: Aisha Blake joins us this week to explain how she ended up speaking at 14 conferences this past year as a junior developer, as well as starting a few of her own.

item.title: Travis Neilson talks UX/UI and the Design Process
item.description: What is UX/UI? Is there a pseudo-code process for design? Google Search Designer Travis Neilson joins us to answer these questions and more!
item.dc:creator: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:author: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:subtitle: What is UX/UI? Is there a pseudo-code process for design? Google Search Designer Travis Neilson joins us to answer these questions and more!

item.title: Our Typical Developer Workdays
item.description: Have you ever wondered what the day-to-day is like for a developer? Lee and Eddie talk about what they do daily and what it's like to actually work as a Junior Developer.
item.dc:creator: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:author: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:subtitle: Have you ever wondered what the day-to-day is like for a developer? Lee and Eddie talk about what they do daily and what it's like to actually work as a Junior Developer.

item.title: Getting into Gatsby with Amberley Romo
item.description: Gatsby Team Member Amberley Romo joins us to tell her story and explain why you should try Gatsby! We also talk about the need for diversity in tech, and the struggles of being a Junior Developer
item.dc:creator: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:author: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:subtitle: Gatsby Team Member Amberley Romo joins us to tell her story and explain why you should try Gatsby! We also talk about the need for diversity in tech, and the struggles of being a Junior Developer

item.title: Hacking the Job Search with Vincent Tang
item.description: Have you ever wondered how LinkedIn or Indeed work? Vincent Tang has done the research and joins us on the show to share his findings on how to raise your visibility when looking for a job!
item.dc:creator: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:author: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:subtitle: Have you ever wondered how LinkedIn or Indeed work? Vincent Tang has done the research and joins us on the show to share his findings on how to raise your visibility when looking for a job!

item.title: How to learn Java with Michael Kimball, The Code Operative
item.description: We're Oscar Mike with The Code Operative! Michael Kimball is a backend developer with his own YouTube channel dedicated to teaching Java, and this week he answers our questions about the language and how to get started.
item.dc:creator: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:author: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:subtitle: We're Oscar Mike with The Code Operative! Michael Kimball is a backend developer with his own YouTube channel dedicated to teaching Java, and this week he answers our questions about the language and how to get started.

item.title: Roy Jossfolk talks Freelancing for Junior Devs
item.description: Freelance Web Developer Roy Jossfolk joins us to share his strategies for freelancing and common pitfalls to avoid when getting started.
item.dc:creator: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:author: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:subtitle: Freelance Web Developer Roy Jossfolk joins us to share his strategies for freelancing and common pitfalls to avoid when getting started.

item.title: Career Coach Chad Bostick on Getting Hired as a Junior Developer
item.description: Developer Career Coach Chad Bostick joins us to talk about how to get hired as a junior dev with no experience, resume tips, salary negotiations, and more!
item.dc:creator: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:author: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:subtitle: Developer Career Coach Chad Bostick joins us to talk about how to get hired as a junior dev with no experience, resume tips, salary negotiations, and more!

item.title: On Music and Development
item.description: Lee and Eddie discuss similarities between musicians and developers, and how the journey of learning music maps to that of a budding developer.
item.dc:creator: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:author: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:subtitle: Lee and Eddie discuss similarities between musicians and developers, and how the journey of learning music maps to that of a budding developer.

item.title: Dev Interview: Scott Tolinski
item.description: Special guest Scott Tolinski of Level Up Tutorials and the Syntax podcast joins us to talk about his journey, business, and to answer all of your listener submitted questions!
item.dc:creator: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:author: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:subtitle: Special guest Scott Tolinski of Level Up Tutorials and the Syntax podcast joins us to talk about his journey, business, and to answer all of your listener submitted questions!

item.title: Dealing with Impostor Syndrome
item.description: Lee and Eddie talk about their run-ins with impostor syndrome and give advice on how to short-circuit those feelings when they surface.
item.dc:creator: Lee Warrick & Edwin Otero
item.itunes:author: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:subtitle: Lee and Eddie talk about their run-ins with impostor syndrome and give advice on how to short-circuit those feelings when they surface.

item.title: jQuery!
item.description: In this episode, we talk about jQuery! Should you learn it or should we pronouce jQuery and let it rest in peace?
item.dc:creator: Lee Warrick & Edwin Otero
item.itunes:author: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode, we talk about jQuery! Should you learn it or should we pronouce jQuery and let it rest in peace?

item.title: Should you do a Coding Bootcamp?
item.description: In this Episode, Lee and Eddie talk about their experiences in a coding Bootcamp. Was it worth it? Do bootcamps deserve the ire of the tech industry?
item.dc:creator: Lee Warrick & Eddie Otero
item.itunes:author: Lee Warrick and Edwin Otero
item.itunes:subtitle: In this Episode, Lee and Eddie talk about their experiences in a coding Bootcamp. Was it worth it? Do bootcamps deserve the ire of the tech industry?

item.title: Pilot Episode
item.description: In this first episode, we introduce the show and ourselves
